translation: "When the king heard this, he rejoiced and went under the bodhi tree. Seeing the bodhi tree, he didn't look away for a moment and spoke a verse, saying, 'Nothing the king has ever done has been done, and I should now make offerings to him who holds the country in his vase.

source_sentence: 諸乳及香水，　　華香及塗香，　　當復供養僧，　　賢聖五部眾。』
translation: Milk and perfume, flowers and perfumes, I will also make offerings to the saṃgha and the five noble families.'

source_sentence: 「時，王各辦四寶瓮，金、銀、琉璃、頗梨，盛諸香乳，及諸香湯，持種種飲食，幡幢、寶蓋各有千種，及種種花香伎樂，受持八支齋布薩，著白淨衣服，執持香鑪，在於殿上，向四方作禮，心念口言：『如來賢聖弟子在諸方者，憐愍我故，受我供養。』
translation: "The king then each prepared a four-jewel urn of gold, silver, beryl, and pāri filled with fragrant milk and aromatic baths, carried various foods, had a thousand different kinds of banners and jeweled shrouds, and various flowers and music, performed the eight precepts, wore white and pure clothing, carried a censer, and saluted in all directions in the palace, saying with his mind and mouth, 'Good and noble disciples of the Tathāgata in various directions have kindness for me and accept my offerings.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『如來賢聖子，　　正順寂諸根，　　離諸三界欲，　　諸天應供養，　　今當悉來集，　　受我微心惠，　　哀愍副我意，　　令法種增長，　　常樂於寂止，　　解脫諸所著，　　如來之真子，　　從法而化生，　　諸天所供養，　　哀愍於我故，　　今當悉來集，　　副我之微意，　　諸聖在處處，　　罽賓多波婆，　　大林離波多，　　阿耨大池邊，　　江河山藪間，　　如是一切處，　　諸聖在中者，　　今當悉來集，　　哀愍於我故，　　副我之微意，　　又在於天上，　　尸梨沙宮殿，　　香山石室中，　　神通具足者，　　今當悉來集，　　哀愍於我故。』
translation: 而說偈言：「『如來賢聖子，　　正順寂諸根，　　離諸三界欲，　　諸天應供養，　　今當悉來集，　　受我微心惠，　　哀愍副我意，　　令法種增長，　　常樂於寂止，　　解脫諸所著，　　如來之真子，　　從法而化生，　　諸天所供養，　　哀愍於我故，　　今當悉來集，　　副我之微意，　　諸聖在處處，　　罽賓多波婆，　　大林離波多，　　阿耨大池邊，　　江河山藪間，　　如是一切處，　　諸聖在中者，　　今當悉來集，　　哀愍於我故，　　副我之微意，　　又在於天上，　　尸梨沙宮殿，　　香山石室中，　　神通具足者，　　今當悉來集，　　哀愍於我故。』

source_sentence: 「時，王如是語時，三十萬比丘悉來集。
translation: "When the king said this, 300,000 monks came together.

source_sentence: 彼大眾中十萬是阿羅漢，二十萬是學人及凡夫比丘，上座之座無人坐。
translation: Of that crowd, 100,000 were arhats, 200,000 were student monks and ordinary monks, and there was no one sitting on the top seat.

source_sentence: 「時，王問諸比丘：『上座之座，云何而無人坐？』
translation: "The king then asked the monks, 'Why is there no one sitting on the top seat?'

source_sentence: 時，彼大眾中有一比丘，名曰耶舍，是大阿羅漢，具足六通，白王言：『此座，上座之座，餘者豈敢於中而坐？』
translation: A monk named Yaśas, a great arhat who had all six supernormal powers, then said to the king, 'How dare the rest of you sit in this seat, the seat of the superior seat?'

source_sentence: 「王復問曰：『於尊者所，更有上座耶？』
translation: "The king again asked, 'Is there another superior seat at the venerable's residence?'

source_sentence: 尊者答曰：『更有上座，大王！
translation: The Venerable replied, 'There's a higher seat, Great King!

source_sentence: 佛之所說，名曰賓頭盧，是上座，應坐此處。』
translation: The Buddha's teaching is called 'Piṇḍola,' and this is the superior seat, where he should sit.

source_sentence: 「王大歡喜，而作是言：『於中有比丘見佛者不？』
translation: "The king rejoiced greatly and said, 'Is there a monk here who has seen the Buddha?'

source_sentence: 尊者答曰：『有也，大王！
translation: The Venerable replied, 'Yes, my lord!

source_sentence: 賓頭盧者，猶故在世。』
translation: 'Piṇḍola is still in the world.'

source_sentence: 「王復白曰：『可得見彼比丘不？』
translation: "The king then said, 'Can I see that monk?'

source_sentence: 尊者曰：『大王！
translation: The venerable said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 不久當見，尋當來至。』
translation: 'I will see it soon, and I will expect it to come.'

source_sentence: 「時，王生大歡喜，而說偈言：「『我今快得利，　　攝受於我故，　　令我自目見，　　尊者賓頭盧。』
translation: "The king then became greatly elated and spoke a verse, saying, "Now, I've quickly gained a benefit that's been taken in by me and made visible to my own eyes, Venerable Piṇḍola."

source_sentence: 「時，尊者賓頭盧將無量阿羅漢，次第相隨。
translation: "Venerable Piṇḍola then brought along a multitude of arhats in succession.

source_sentence: 譬如鴈王乘虛而來，在於上座處坐。
translation: It was like the king of the flock who rode up in the sky and sat down at the top seat.

source_sentence: 諸比丘僧各修禮敬，次第而坐。
translation: The monks and nuns each paid homage and reverence, and they sat down in turn.

source_sentence: 「時，王見尊者賓頭盧頭髮皓白，辟支佛體，頭面禮足，長跪合掌，覩尊者顏貌，而說偈言：「『我今之王位，　　統領閻浮提，　　不以為歡喜，　　今得見尊者，　　我今見尊者，　　便是見生佛，　　心懷大踊躍，　　勝見於王位。』
translation: "When the king saw Venerable Piṇḍola with white-haired hair and the body of Pārśva, he bowed his head and feet, knelt down long with his palms together, and looked at his features, he spoke in verse, saying, "Now, I've been on the throne, ruling Jambudvīpa, and I wasn't rejoicing, but now I've gotten to see the venerable, and now that I've seen the venerable, I've seen the Buddha who was born, and I'm greatly encouraged, for I'm better off on the throne."

source_sentence: 「復白尊者曰：『尊者見世尊耶？
translation: "Again, he said to the Venerable, 'Does the Venerable see the Bhagavān?'

source_sentence: 三界所尊仰。』
translation: It's revered in the three realms.'

source_sentence: 「時，尊者賓頭盧以手舉眉毛，視王而言：「『我見於如來，　　於世無譬類，　　身作黃金色，　　三十二相好，　　面如淨滿月，　　梵音聲柔軟，　　伏諸煩惱諍，　　常處於寂滅。』
translation: "Venerable Piṇḍola then raised his eyebrows with his hands, looked at the king, and said, "I've seen a Tathāgata who has no parallel in the world, whose body is golden in color, has thirty-two beautiful features, has a face like a pure full moon, has the gentle voice of Brahmā, quells afflictions and disputes, and is always in a state of tranquility."

source_sentence: 「王復問曰：『尊者何處見佛？』
translation: "The king then asked, 'Venerable, where do I see the Buddha?'

source_sentence: 尊者曰：『如來將五百阿羅漢，俱初在王舍城安居，我爾時亦復在中。』
translation: The Venerable said, 'The Tathāgata had 500 arhats all first settled in Rājagṛha, and I was also there at the time.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『大牟尼世尊，　　離欲相圍遶，　　在於王舍城，　　結於夏三月。
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, 'The Bhagavān, who's free of desire and surrounded by people, was in Rājagṛha during the summer retreat.

source_sentence: 我時在彼眾，　　恒住如來邊，　　大王今當知，　　我目見真佛。』
translation: I was among them, and I was always at the Tathāgata's side. Now, Great King, you should know that I have seen the true Buddha with my eyes.'

source_sentence: 「『又復，佛住舍衛國時，如來大作神力，種種變化，作諸佛形，滿在諸方，乃至阿迦尼吒天，我爾時亦在於中，見如來種種變化神通之相。』
translation: "'Furthermore, when the Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, the Tathāgata exercised great supernormal powers and various transformations, creating the forms of buddhas everywhere, even up to the Akaniṣṭha Heaven, where I was also present at the time and saw the Tathāgata's various transformations and miraculous appearances.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『如來神通力，　　降伏諸外道，　　佛遊於十方，　　我親見彼相。』
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'The Tathāgata's supernormal powers have subdued non-Buddhists, and the Buddha has traveled to the ten directions, and I've personally seen his features.'

source_sentence: 「『又復，如來在天上與母說法時，我亦在於中；與母說法竟，將諸天眾從天上來，下僧迦奢國。
translation: "'Furthermore, when the Tathāgata was up in heaven explaining the teaching to his mother, I was there, too; after he finished explaining the teaching to her, he sent a multitude of gods down from heaven to the country of Saṃkāśya.

source_sentence: 時，我見此二事。
translation: I then saw these two things.

source_sentence: 天人受福樂，優波羅比丘尼化作轉輪聖王，將無量眷屬，乘空而來，詣世尊所，我亦見此。』
translation: The gods were blessed, and I saw Upāsaka Bhikṣuṇī transform into a wheel-turning sage king who brought measureless retinues in the sky to the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『如來在天上，　　於彼結夏坐，　　我亦在於中，　　牟尼之眷屬。』
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, 'The Tathāgata is up in the heavens, sitting there in the summer retreat, and I'm here, too, among the Muni's retinue.'

source_sentence: 「『又復，世尊住舍衛國，五百阿羅漢俱。
translation: "'Again, the Bhagavān was staying in Śrāvastī with 500 arhats.

source_sentence: 時，給孤獨長者女適在於富樓那跋陀那國。
translation: At the time, an orphaned elderly woman was staying in the country of Pūrṇabhadra.

source_sentence: 時，彼女請佛及比丘僧。
translation: The woman then invited the Buddha and the monks.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘各乘空而往彼，我爾時以神力合大山，往彼受請。
translation: The monks each rode into the sky and went there, and I then combined a large mountain with my supernormal powers and went there to accept the invitation.

source_sentence: 時，世尊責我：「汝那得現神足如是？
translation: The Bhagavān then rebuked me, "How did you attain miraculous powers such as these?

source_sentence: 我今罰汝，常在於世，不得取涅槃，護持我正法，勿令滅也。」』
translation: I now punish you for remaining in the world, for not attaining nirvāṇa, and for safeguarding my right teaching so that it doesn't cease."

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：「『世尊受彼請，　　五百比丘俱，　　時我以神力，　　挑大山而去，　　世尊責罰我，　　住世未滅度，　　護持我正法，　　勿令法沒盡。』
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, 'The Bhagavān accepted their invitation, and five hundred monks accompanied me.

source_sentence: 「『又復，如來將諸比丘僧入城乞食。
translation: "'Again, the Tathāgata sent the monks and nuns into the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，王共二童子沙土中戲，逢見佛來，捧於塵沙，奉上於佛。
translation: When the king and two boys were playing in the sand and dirt, they met the Buddha, took a handful of dust and sand, and presented it to him.

source_sentence: 時，世尊記彼童子：「於我滅度百歲之後，此童子於巴連弗邑當受王位，領閻浮提，名曰阿育。
translation: The Bhagavān then remembered that boy, "A hundred years after I die, this boy will assume the throne at Pāṭaliputra and lead Jambudvīpa, which will be called Aśoka.

source_sentence: 當廣布我舍利，一日之中，當造八萬四千塔。」
translation: He will widely disseminate my relics and build 84,000 stūpas in a single day."

source_sentence: 今王身是也。
translation: This is the king's body now.

source_sentence: 我爾時亦在於中。』
translation: At the time, I was in it.'

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：「『王於童子時，　　以沙奉上佛，　　佛記於王時，　　我亦親在中。』
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, 'When he was a boy, the king offered sand to the Buddha, and when the Buddha remembered it to the king, I was also present in it.'

source_sentence: 「時，王白尊者曰：『尊者今住在何處？』
translation: "The king then said to the venerable, 'Where is he staying now, Venerable?'

source_sentence: 尊者答王曰：『在於北山，山名揵陀摩羅，共諸同梵行僧。』
translation: The Venerable replied to the king, 'On the northern mountain, there's a mountain named Gandhamāra with monks who practice with the priests.'

source_sentence: 「王復問曰：『有幾眷屬？』
translation: "The king then asked, 'How many members of the retinue are there?'

source_sentence: 尊者答：『六萬阿羅漢比丘。』
translation: The Venerable replied, 'Sixty thousand arhat monks.'

source_sentence: 尊者曰：『王何須多問？
translation: The venerable said, 'Why does the king need to ask more questions?'

source_sentence: 今當施設供養於僧。
translation: 'Now, you will make an offering to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 食竟，使王歡喜。』
translation: When you've finished eating, make the king happy.'

source_sentence: 王言：『如是，尊者！
translation: The king said, 'So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 然我今先當供養佛念所覺菩提之樹，然後香美飲食施設於僧。』
translation: Now, however, I will first make offerings to the bodhi tree that the Buddha's mindfulness awakens to, and then I will offer fragrant food and drink to the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 勅諸群臣，唱令國界：『王今捨十萬兩金布施眾僧，千瓮香湯溉灌菩提樹，集諸五眾。』
translation: I commanded the ministers to order the kingdom to declare, 'Now, the king will give 100,000 taels of gold as alms to the saṃgha, and a thousand pots of fragrant baths will be used to water the bodhi tree and gather the five groups of people.'

source_sentence: 「時，王子名曰拘那羅，在王右邊，舉二指而不言說，意欲二倍供養。
translation: "A prince named Kunala was at the king's right side, holding up two fingers without saying anything, intending to make offerings twice over.

source_sentence: 大眾見之，皆盡發笑，王亦發笑，而語言：『嗚呼！
translation: When the crowd saw him, they all laughed, and the king also laughed and said, 'Whoops!

source_sentence: 王子！
translation: Prince!

source_sentence: 乃有增益功德供養。』
translation: Then there will be offerings of enhanced merit.'

source_sentence: 「王復言：『我復以三十萬兩金供養眾僧，復加千瓮香湯，洗浴菩提樹。』
translation: "The king then said, 'I'll make another offering of 300,000 taels of gold to the saṃgha and add a thousand jars of fragrant bathing water to wash the bodhi tree.'

source_sentence: 時，王子復舉四指，意在四倍。
translation: The prince then raised his four fingers again, intending it to be four times as much.

source_sentence: 「時，王瞋恚，語臣曰：『誰教王子作是事，與我興競？』
translation: "The king then became angry and said to his ministers, 'Who taught the prince to do this and compete with me?'

source_sentence: 臣啟王言：『誰敢與王興競？
translation: I inspired the king to say, 'Who dares to compete with the king?'

source_sentence: 然王子聰慧利根，增益功德，故作是事耳！』
translation: However, the prince's wise and clever faculties have enhanced his virtue, so he did this!'

source_sentence: 「時，王右顧視王子，白上座曰：『除我庫藏之物，餘一切物，閻浮提夫人、婇女、諸臣、眷屬，及我拘那羅子，皆悉布施賢聖眾僧，唱令國界，集諸五眾。』
translation: "The king then looked right at the prince and said to the superior throne, 'Except for the goods in my treasury, the wife of Jambudvīpa, her daughters, her ministers, her retinue, and I, the son of Kunarā, have all donated them to the noble monks and saints, and we've called the kingdom a gathering of the five groups of people.'

source_sentence: 而說偈曰：「『除王庫藏物，　　夫人及婇女，　　臣民一切眾，　　布施賢聖僧，　　我身及王子，　　亦復悉捨與。』
translation: He spoke the verse, "Except for the king's treasury, his wife and daughters, and all of his subjects, they all gave alms to the noble monks, and I myself and my prince also gave them all up."

source_sentence: 「時，王、上座及比丘僧，以瓮香湯洗浴菩提樹。
translation: "The king, his high priest, and the monks then washed the bodhi tree in a pot of fragrant hot water.

source_sentence: 「時，菩提樹倍復嚴好，增長茂盛，以偈頌曰：「『王浴菩提樹，　　無上之所覺，　　樹增於茂盛，　　柯條葉柔軟。』
translation: "The bodhi tree then grew even more beautiful and luxuriant, and he spoke in verse, saying, 'The king bathes the bodhi tree, which is unsurpassed in its awakening, and it prospers and flourishes, its branches and leaves becoming supple.'

source_sentence: 「時，王及諸群臣生大歡喜。
translation: "At the time, the king and his ministers rejoiced greatly.

source_sentence: 「時，王洗浴菩提樹已，次復供養眾僧。
translation: "After he had washed the bodhi tree, the king then made offerings to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時，彼上座耶舍語王言：『大王！
translation: Then, that superior seat, Yaśas, said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今大有比丘僧集，當發淳信心供養。』
translation: Now, there's a great assembly of monks and nuns, so you must make offerings with pure faith.'

source_sentence: 時，王從上至下，自手供養。
translation: The king then offered the offerings with his own hands, from top to bottom.

source_sentence: 「時，彼有二沙彌，得食已，各以麨團歡喜丸，更互相擲。
translation: "At the time, there were two ascetics who, after getting their food, each gave a ball of bread and a joy ball, and then tossed it at each other.

source_sentence: 王見即笑而言：『此沙彌作小兒戲。』
translation: Seeing this, the king laughed and said, 'This śrāmaṇer is playing like a child.'

source_sentence: 供養訖已，王還上座前立。
translation: After making his offerings, the king returned to stand in front of the superior throne.

source_sentence: 上座語王言：『王莫生不信敬心。』
translation: The ascended throne said to the king, 'Don't become disillusioned and disrespectful, King.'

source_sentence: 王答上座：『無有不敬心，然見二沙彌作小兒戲，如世間小兒，以土團更互相擲。
translation: The king answered the ascended seat, 'There's no disrespectful attitude, but I saw those two śrāmaṇeras playing like children in the world who toss clumps of dirt at each other.'

source_sentence: 如是二沙彌以麨團、以歡喜丸，更互相擲。』
translation: Thus, these two śrāmaṇeras tossed a ball of sand and a joy ball at each other.'

source_sentence: 上座白王言：『彼二沙彌是俱解脫阿羅漢，更相奉食。』
translation: The superior monk said to the king, 'Those two śrāmaṇeras are arhats who are both liberated and who further serve each other.'

source_sentence: 王聞是已，增其信心，而作是念：『此二沙彌能展轉相施，我今亦當於一切僧人施絹、劫貝。』
translation: After hearing this, the king's faith increased and he thought, 'Now that these two śrāmaṇeras can give to each other in turn, I will also give silk and karpāsa to all the saṃgha.'

source_sentence: 「時，二沙彌知王心所念，二沙彌共相謂言：『令王倍增敬信。』
translation: "Knowing what the king was thinking, the two śrāmaṇeras said to each other, 'Let the king's faith grow stronger.'

source_sentence: 一沙彌持鑊授與王，一沙彌授以染草。
translation: One śrāmaṇer took a wok and gave it to the king, and the other gave him dyed grass.

source_sentence: 王問彼沙彌：『用作何等？』
translation: The king asked the śrāmaṇeras, 'What will it be used for?'

source_sentence: 二沙彌白王言：『王因我故，施與眾僧絹及劫貝，我欲令大王染成其色，施與眾僧。』
translation: The two novices said to the king, 'The king has given the monks silk and karpāsa because of me, and I want the great king to dye it and give it to the monks.'

source_sentence: 「時，王作是念：『我雖心念，口未發言。
translation: "The king then thought, 'Although I'm mindful, I haven't spoken with my mouth.

source_sentence: 此二達士得他心智，而知我心。』
translation: These two adepts have knowledge of the minds of others and know mine.'

source_sentence: 王即稽首敬禮眾僧，而說偈言：「『孔雀之族姓，　　內外親眷屬，　　因此惠施故，　　悉皆獲大利，　　遭值良福田，　　歡喜應時施。』
translation: The king then bowed his head in respect to the saṃgha and spoke a verse, saying, 'The Peacock clan, its inner and outer family members, and their generosity have all been made great by this, and they've found a good field of merit in which to rejoice and give at the right time.'

source_sentence: 「時，王語沙彌言：『我因汝等施僧衣，施僧衣已，復以三衣并四億萬兩珍寶，嚫五部眾；嚫願已，復以四十億萬兩珍寶，贖取閻浮提宮人、婇女，及太子、群臣。』
translation: "The king then said to the śrāmaṇeras, 'I've given you monks' robes as a result, and after giving you monks' robes, I've given three robes and 400,000,000 liang of treasure to five groups of people; after giving and vowing to give, I'll also give 4,000,000,000 liang of treasure to redeem the palace and Ṛṣipatana women, princes, and ministers of Jambudvī.'

source_sentence: 「阿育王所作功德，無量如是。」
translation: "The merits that King Aśoka has wrought are immeasurable."

source_sentence: 雜阿含經卷第二十三
translation: *Saṃyuktâgama-sūtra, Vol. 23
